resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/103492</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>103492</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770206762</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Arctic and Antarctic</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Arktis und Antarktis</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Arctique et ANTARCTIQUE</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ártico e antarctic</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Artide ed ANTARTIDE</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αρκτική και ανταρκτική</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ártico y antártico</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">looks at research being conducted in the two polar regions of earth. These vast, icy, inhospitable environments provide natural laboratories for scientists to study basic questions: How did the universe begin? Is earth's climate changing? What are the limits of life in extreme environments?</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Social Sciences</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Blicke auf die Forschung, die in die zwei polaren 
Regionen von Masse geleitet wird. Diese beträchtlichen, 
eisigen, unwirtlichen Umgebungen stellen natürliche Labors für 
Wissenschaftler zur Verfügung, um grundlegende Fragen zu studieren: 
Wie fing das Universum an? Ändert Klima der Masse? 
Was sind die Begrenzungen auf das Leben in den extremen 
Umgebungen?</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">regards à la recherche étant conduite dans les 
deux régions polaires de la terre. Ces vastes, glacials, 
inhospitaliers environnements fournissent les laboratoires normaux 
pour des scientifiques pour étudier des questions de base : 
Comment l'univers a-t-il commencé ? Le climat de la terre
change-t-il ? Quelles sont les limites de la vie dans les 
environnements extrêmes ?</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">olhares na pesquisa que está sendo conduzida nas 
duas regiões polares da terra. Estes ambientes vastos, gelados,
inhospitable fornecem laboratórios naturais para cientistas para 
estudar perguntas básicas: Como o universo começou? O 
clima da terra está mudando? Que são os limites da vida em 
ambientes extremos?</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">sguardi a ricerca che è condotta nelle due 
regioni polari di terra. Questi ambienti ampi, ghiacciati, 
inhospitable forniscono i laboratori naturali per gli scienziati per 
studiare le domande di base: Come l'universo ha cominciato? 
Il clima della terra sta cambiando? Che cosa sono i limiti
di vita negli ambienti estremi?</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">εξετάζει την έρευνα που πραγματοποιείται στις δύο 
πολικές περιοχές της γης. Αυτά τα απέραντα, παγωμένα, 
αφιλόξενα περιβάλλοντα παρέχουν τα φυσικά εργαστήρια για τους 
επιστήμονες στις βασικές ερωτήσεις μελέτης: Πώς ο κόσμος 
άρχισε; Το γήινο κλίμα αλλάζει; Ποια είναι τα όρια 
της ζωής στα ακραία περιβάλλοντα;</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">miradas en la investigación que es conducida en 
las dos regiones polares de la tierra. Estos ambientes extensos,
helados, inhospitalarios proporcionan a los laboratorios naturales 
para los científicos para estudiar preguntas básicas: ¿Cómo 
el universo comenzó? ¿El clima de la tierra está cambiando? 
¿Cuáles son los límites de la vida en ambientes extremos?</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Sozialwissenschaften</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les Sciences Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciências Sociais</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienze Sociali</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Κοινωνικές επιστήμες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencias Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770206762</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Custom License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>103492</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/arctic-and-antarctic</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
